sources.title: "Logging In Maine" (1906) cinematographer Billy Bitzer
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems   "Logging in Maine" (1906) is a very short documentary.  The film is included in our program to illustrate the work of Billy Bitzer, a star of Silent Hall of Fame. In addition to being the cinematographer, IMDB gives Billy Bitzer credit as a director and if this is confirmed this film would be one of very few films, for which Billy Bitzer receives this distinction. Let's all give our thanks to the Library of Congress for preserving this film and making it available to the public. Directed by                       unknown Cinematography by         Billy Bitzer Starring                             unknown Distributed by                   Biograph Company Release date                      June 19, 1906 Country                             United States Running time                    5 m. Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. Fair use is a use permitted by copyright statute that might otherwise be infringing. Non-profit, educational or personal use tips the balance in favor of fair use."

metadata.Plot: The subject is the movement of cut timber from the forest to the mill. The few scenes that make up the film are loggers performing the various operations necessary to prevent logs from jamming together. The men keep them headed with the flow of the water toward the lake on which the mill is located. The activities of approximately a dozen men were photographed.
